devices_included: Desktop computer; Tabletop, large horizontal display
use_cases_desc: Debugging complex distributed applications using multiple displays and augmented reality overlay
contribution_desc: A multi-display/AR environment for debugging distributed systems. Setup consists of a regular monitor showing text logs, and interactive surface that combines a 2D view on the device with a 3D visualization (in AR) on top of the display that shows what happens in the distributed system.
crossdevice_def:
"MDEs consist of heterogeneous displays, which often do not constitute a continuous display space (with the exception of, e.g., BendDesk [14]), and which have been applied to various application areas, including visual analytics [5]. A more specialized area are distributed user interfaces, where components are distributed across one
or more of the dimensions input, output, platform, space, and time [7]."
